name: Compromised Parthenon
description:
It's Athens, Greece 447 BC and Statesman Percules has been commissioned to build the Parthenon. He has appointed your buddies Ictinus and Callicrates as the lead archetects but they need your help.

*Ictinus - "Percules' mind changes more than the heart of Posiedon!"*

*Callicrates - "Our specs have the will of Artemis!"*

The frustrated archetects elaborate that the dimensions keep changing.

*Ictinus - "He continually worries about angering Helios."*

*Callicrates - "But it still needs to be seen from Mt. Olympus."*

To help your buddies, create a formula to calculate each height division of the Parthenon.

**The dimensions need to be proportionate to how the Parthenon would look if the length and height represented by an approximation of the golden ratio 13/8 (close to how it was actually was built).**

Each division ordered from smallest to largest is beamBottom, beamTop, roof, pillars. If you get stuck find a picture of the original Parthenon.

INPUT - height (in metres).

OUTPUT - An array representing [roof, beamTop, beamBottom, pillars].

(*beamTop and beamBottom are just different sections of the same beam.*)
